OpeningTimes._unparsedString:
A new front counter is being installed at Aldershot Police Station and while the station will remain open to the public during renovations, there will be changes to accessing front counter services from Saturday 7 February.

Construction work starts onsite Monday 9 February and is expected to last for several weeks. During that time a temporary front counter will be located around the side of the building to ensure the public are still able to seek help face-to-face. Space and privacy at the temporary front counter will be limited, so people could consider attending Yateley Police Station on Royal Oak Close, GU46 7UD, or Guildford Police Station (part of nearby Surrey Police) on Margaret Road, GU1 4PZ.

Monday - Saturday 9am - 6pm
Sunday 9:30am - 6pm 

Closed on all Bank Holidays, Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Year's Day

This station is not open to the public unless you have an appointment.

There is a yellow phone at this location which you can use to contact us for help, to report a crime or to ask for advice.

Please refer to our website for accessible hours.

The site remains an operational building used by officers, staff and volunteers.

Our neighbourhood policing teams continue to provide a visible policing presence in the area and will be available in person via our Community Contact Points, which you find here: Dorset Police Contact Points, or you can visit our Mobile Police Stations. To find out locations and times, please visit: Mobile Police Station | Dorset Police

Alternative contact is via the online reporting services on our website. When life or safety is at risk always dial 999.

OpeningTimes._unparsedString:
GILLINGHAM POLICE STATION

Due to required temporary closure of Blandford Police Station Enquiry Office Gillingham Enquiry Office will be open to the public for a temporary period.

Restriction to Enquiry Office services at Gillingham will be collection of seized property or collection of firearms for return. Such services will resume from Blandford on 29th April. 

Gillingham Enquiry Office will be open on the following dates between 1000 – 1500:  

10th 14th 15th 16th 17th 21st 22nd 23rd 24th 28th April.

Following completion of works at Blandford, GILLINGHAM Enquiry Office will re-close.

Normal policing patrols will continue when the Enquiry Office is closed. Alternative contact is via the online reporting services on our website. When life or safety is at risk always dial 999.

Please note that when attending to ensure effort is made to arrive approximately 1 hour prior to closing time to allow your enquiry to be dealt with.

Thank you for your consideration and enabling us to provide as prompt a service as possible.

 

 

 

Gillingham station is otherwise closed to the public.

The available front counter provisions are Bournemouth, Weymouth or Blandford stations (Blandford temporary closure 10th-28th April 2026).

Please refer to our website for accessible hours.

The site remains an operational building used by officers, staff and volunteers.

Our neighbourhood policing teams continue to provide a visible policing presence in the area and will be available in person via our Community Contact Points, which you find here: Dorset Police Contact Points, or you can visit our Mobile Police Stations. To find out locations and times, please visit: Mobile Police Station | Dorset Police

Alternative contact is via the online reporting services on our website. When life or safety is at risk always dial 999.

d3p1:AccessibilityOption.d3p1:DisplayName: Access For People With Reduced Mobility

OpeningTimes._unparsedString:
Wednesday 09:00 to 13:00- 13:30 to 16:00 (Please refer below for potential adjustments)

Saturday    09:00 to 13:00- 13:30 to 16:00 (Please refer below for potential adjustments)

PLEASE REFER BELOW FOR ANY ADJUSTMENTS TO ABOVE ADVERTISED HOURS:

  • 21.02.26 Closed

 

Public Notice: Please note that due to essential safety works at Blandford Station, the Enquiry Office will be closed between 10th April to 28th April. Re-opening 29th April. 

Persons wishing to attend for the following reasons please note: 

  • Bail signers – please use yellow phone outside station entrance.  Report as per normal conditions. 
  • Bail reporting conditions relating to Sex Offender Registration – This  MUST be reported in person at an alternative station (Weymouth or Bournemouth).  This cannot be recorded over phone.
  • Section 165 release requests/ Prohibition Orders/ surrender of firearms or ammunition/ surrender of found property or collection of seized or owned property -  these functions cannot be undertaken at this location between 10th April- 29th April 2026.
  • Licensed Firearms queries - Please contact the Firearms Licensing team via details on our Dorset Police Website.
  • For services requiring in-person engagement please visit Bournemouth or Weymouth Enquiry Offices – dates and times advertised on the DORSET POLICE OFFICIAL WEB SITE only.

Due to required temporary closure Gillingham Enquiry Office will be open to the public for a temporary period. Restriction to Enquiry Office services at Gillingham will be collection of seized property or collection of firearms for return. Such services will resume from Blandford on 29th April. 

  • Gillingham Enquiry Office will be open on the following dates between 1000 – 1500:  10th 14th 15th 16th 17th 21st 22nd 23rd 24th 28th April.

Following completion of works standard Blandford hours and days will resume.

 

Normal policing patrols will continue when the Enquiry Office is closed. Alternative contact is via the online reporting services on our website. When life or safety is at risk always dial 999.

Please note that when attending to ensure effort is made to arrive approximately 1 hour prior to closing time to allow your enquiry to be dealt with.

Thank you for your consideration and enabling us to provide as prompt a service as possible.

Please note: No Dogs are permitted in the Enquiry Offices, with exception of registered support dogs assisting with hearing or sight impairment, or emotional support. Service Support Dogs must remain leashed and in owners control at all times. Thank you for your cooperation.

OpeningTimes._unparsedString:
Skipton Police Station from Monday the 2nd of February 2026 the opening hours will be from 10am to 2pm until further notice.

We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause. 

Skipton Police Station is Closed on weekends and Closed on bank holidays.

Please note:

Due to ongoing staffing recruitment, the opening days and times of Skipton police enquiry office may vary at short notice.

Your closest police station enquiry office open 0800hrs to 2000hrs daily is Harrogate Police Station, Beckwith Head Road, Harrogate HG3 1FR.

We are also contactable on 101 and via our online reporting or live chat via the North Yorkshire Police website.
